motd:
This build introduces support for the discover feature in Radarr! Similar to the web GUI, it will build out a list of movies to add based on your import lists and Radarr suggestions (which can be disabled in the settings).

This build also fixes many issues with the current nightly builds, including fixing the ability to add new movies.

A feature that was removed with this build is the ability to sort/categorize drawer entries. In the future, the drawer will get more customizable options to replace what this option offered.

And lastly in this build is a minor UI change, changing "Home" to "Dashboard" to prepare for a much more powerful dashboard in the future.

changes: "Home" has been renamed to "Dashboard"
If no movie is found in the search query, given an option to search to add the movie
Add the ability to discover movies from your import lists & Radarr recommendations
Ability to set sorting direction, category, and filtering method
Ability to toggle on or off Radarr suggestions in the discover page
Removed the option to use categories/folders in the drawer
Add pages within modules for cleaner isolation and easier expansion for future configuration options
Renaming a profile now checks for an existing profile with the same name within the prompt
Adding a profile now checks for an existing profile with the same name within the prompt
The delete profile prompt now hides the currently enabled profile, and shows a snackbar if only one profile exists
Allow clearing the broadcast and MAC addresses to empty values
Support for Radarr v3.1.0+ (nightly builds)
Instantly show a movie as addable again if removed right after adding it
If a job or character name is empty, show a dash instead of an empty space
Instantly remove the movie tile when removing a movie
Padding around the "Update Movie" button was incorrect
In some cases, the error was not being passed through to the error viewer
Upstream framework support for basic mouse/trackpad highlight and scrolling support
Tapping the AppBar to scroll back in a nested route would scroll back the parent route as well
Use the recommended safe area padding at the bottom of lists for fullscreen devices
